posts.title: Low Carb Sushi
posts.content:
Do not be tempted by sushi rolls that are loaded with white rice, mayonnaise, cream cheese, barbecue sauce and tempura.  These extras calories wreak havoc on your waistline.

Recipe:

  • slightly moisten a Nori sheet with a few splashes of water
  • lay the sheet flat and place the following in a horizontal row (see photo):
    • 2 oz smoked salmon
    • 3 TBSP of finely sliced cucumber strips
    • 1/4 of an avocado
    • 1/4 of a cup of alfalfa sprouts
    • garnish with hot chili pepper flakes
  • roll the nori paper (moisten to seal it)
  • let sit one minute before cutting into 6 maki pieces.

*note: I skip the soy sauce (because I don’t like it!).  1 TBSP of soy sauce has about 1000mg of sodium!  If you like soy sauce, then use a low sodium option or a  calorie free/low sodium option, such as Bragg’s Soy Sauce Alternative.

Smoked Salmon Facts:

  • Smoked salmon has a high nutrient content; however, its high levels of sodium make it a delicacy that should be eaten in moderation and avoided by those with heart conditions.
  • A 4 ounce serving of smoked salmon contains no sugar and 27 g of high-quality protein.
  • It contains high amounts of heart-healthy omega-3 fatty acids, which are known to reduce your risk of heart disease.
  • Smoked salmon has less omega-3’s than non-smoked salmon
  • One serving of smoked salmon contains 71% of your recommended daily intake of vitamin B12, 44% of vitamin B1 (niacin), 32% of vitamin B6, and 31% of phosphorus.
  • Wild Alaskan smoked salmon has the lowest contamination risk (negligible mercury levels).
  • Because the salmon is smoked, it may contain toxic substances called polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs), which are known to increase the risk of cancer.
  • High heat smoking creates more undesirable PAHs.
  • Cold-smoked salmon (70-100F for at least 12 hours) contain less PAHs, but is typically preserved with carcinogenic nitrates or nitrites for a longer shelf-life.
  • Smoked salmon is not as healthy as fresh or canned salmon.  Nevertheless, most people who are in good health are able to benefit from smoked salmon because they have healthy detoxification systems that can process and eliminate the PAHs or preservatives found in smoked fish.
  • References:
    • http://whfoods.org/genpage.php?tname=dailytip&dbid=320’
    • http://www.livestrong.com/article/377233-is-smoked-salmon-healthy/

Nutritional Information:

(for 1 roll = 6 maki)

  • Calories: 199, fat: 13.6g, saturated fat: 2.1g, cholesterol: 51.5mg, sodium: 397mg, carbohydrates: 6.3g, fiber: 3.6g, net carbs: 2.7g, sugars: 0.7g, protein: 14.9g

Compare this to a conventional salmon/avocado/rice sushi roll in a restaurant:

  • Calories: 330, fat: 7g, saturated fat: 1.5g, cholesterol: 20mg, sodium: 520mg, carbohydrates: 51g, fiber: 7g, net carbs: 44g, sugars: 7g, protein: 15g

Ingredient Information:

=> Find detailed explanations about the ingredients I used in this recipe by clicking on my Ingredient Encyclopedia!

posts.title: Low Carb Pasta
posts.content:
Hungry?

Enjoy a Colossal Portion of Pasta – Minus the Guilt!

This is my Tofu Shirataki Pasta with Chicken, Bok Choy, Sundried Tomato and Spicy Cheesy Sauce

Why this Recipe is AWESOME!
  • Low carb (only 7 net carbs)
  • Under 220 calories
  • Low sugar
  • Diabetic friendly
  • High in fiber
  • Gluten-free
  • Dairy-free
  • Very delicious!
Recipe:
Step 1: Prepare the Fettuccine

  • Drain and thoroughly rinse 1 package (8 oz) Tofu Shirataki Fettuccine Shaped Noodle Substitute (USA Shoppers).  Canadian shoppers please click here.
    • This is a low calorie/low carb/gluten-free pasta alternative made from blending the root of the Konnyaku (a member of the yam family) and tofu.
  • Boil for 2-3 min
  • Dry very well

Step 2: Steam the Bok Choy

  • wash the bok choy
  • cut off the base of the bok choy and measure 1 cup of it.
  • steam the bok choy by placing it in a pot of boiling water.  Cover and steam for 5 minutes or until the leaves are tender

Step 3: Grill the Chicken

  • on a non-stick skillet (or use non-stick cooking spray), grill a skinless chicken breast
  • cut into bite-size pieces and measure 4 oz using your kitchen scale.

Step 4: Combine all your Ingredients and Season

  • 1 TBSP nutritional yeast – this imparts a cheesy flavour.  Click to read more about Nutritional yeast and where to buy it.
  • 1 TBSP Sundried Tomato Bits
  • pepper, salt-free Mrs Dash
  • hot chill pepper flakes or cut up a mini hot pepper.  Hot peppers are a great way to kick your metabolism up a notch.  For more information, read my article on Foods and Recipes That Boost Metabolism!

Nutritional Information:

calories: 219, fat: 3g, saturated fat: 0, cholesterol: 75 mg, sodium: 163 mg, carbohydrates: 15.1g, dietary fiber: 8 g, NET CARBS: 7.1g, sugars: 4 g, protein: 35 g

posts.title: Peanut Butter Cups
posts.content:
Do not be seduced by conventional Peanut Butter Cups, which are laden with sugar and salt!

Did you know that 2 Reese’s Peanut Butter cups contain 210 calories, 13 g fat, 5 g saturated fat, 5 mg cholesterol, 150 mg sodium, 24 g carbohydrates, 1 g fiber, 21 g of sugars and only 5 g of protein*?

Try my Peanut Butter Cup recipe instead!

  • Gluten-free
  • Low carb, low sugar, diabetic friendly
  • High protein

Recipe: Watch the QUICK Video Demonstration

note: this recipe yields 2 peanut butter cups

Ingredient/Armamentarium Checklist

  1. 1 scoop of BSN Syntha-6 Isolate in Chocolate Milkshake Flavour
  2. 2 tsp of All Natural Peanut Butter , or if you really want to save calories, then use 1 TBSP PB2!
  3. water
  4. freezer
  5. Silicone baking cups
  6. Measuring Spoons

click for silicone baking cups from amazon.com

Nutritional Information:

Note: The nutritional info will vary according to the brand of chocolate whey isolate you elect to use.  I used BSN because it’s low in carbs, fat, sugar and sodium.

If you use BSN’s Isolate and 1 TBSP of PB2, then 2 PB cups will be:

  • calories: 163, fat: 2g, saturated fat: 0g, cholesterol: 15mg, sodium: 225mg, carbohydrates: 10g, fiber: 2.5g,  Net carbs: 7.5 g, sugars 3.5g, protein 27g

If you want instant PB cups without any effort, then I recommend you order Quest Protein Peanut Butter Cups from Bodybuilding.com!

And now for a twist on an old favourite!

Rob used a different flavour of whey! Brilliant!

posts.title: Mushroom Onion Cheeseburger (Gluten-Free/Dairy-Free)
posts.content:
What’s gluten-free, dairy-free, soy-free, low carb and deliciously juicy?

The Fat-Blasting Doctor’s Mushroom Onion Cheeseburger!

Notice I used 2 large portobello mushroom caps instead of refined white hamburger buns.

Recipe:

In a food processor, combine the following:

  • 12 oz of extra lean ground chicken
  • 2 TBSP of Organic Gluten-Free Whole Ground Golden Flaxseed Meal
  • 1/2 cup of white onion chopped
  • 1/4 cup of Daiya Cheese Shreds
  • Salt-free seasoning of your choice, pepper, minced garlic

Process the ingredients.  Make 4 patties. Preheat your non-stick skillet, which you can coat with Pam non-stick cooking spray.

  • grill the 4 patties (flip to ensure both sides are cooked).  Cut the center to ensure it is fully cooked.
The “buns”: grill 2 large portobello mushroom caps but remove the stems first. (I used my Cuisinart Griddler, which I sprayed with Pam non-stick cooking spray)
.

Nutritional Information

->for 1 burger: 3 oz chicken

  • calories: 238, fat: 12.3g, saturated fat: 8.5g, cholesterol: 64.1mg, sodium: 164.2mg, carbohydrates: 13.5 g, fiber: 5.6g, NET CARBS: 7.9 g, sugars: 5.3 g, protein: 22.7 g

Compare this to a conventional restaurant style mushroom onion cheeseburger:

  • calories: 878, fat: 55 g, cholesterol: 157mg, sodium: 1208mg, carbohydrates: 44.8g, fiber: 2.3g, protein: 49.4g

Ingredient Information:

=> Find detailed explanations about the ingredients I used in this recipe by clicking on my Ingredient Encyclopedia!

posts.title: Snickers Fudge
posts.content:
Snickers

Today’s Challenge: Create a “cleaner” version of the Snickers® Peanut Butter Chocolate Bar.

  • Snickers® released a new chocolate bar called, Snickers® Peanut Butter Squared.
  • This bad boy consists of nougat, peanut butter, peanuts and fudge all enveloped in a layer of milk chocolate.
  • It looks great, until you look at the ingredients and nutritional information: 24 g of sugar!
  • Eating this chocolate bar would be the equivalent of eating 4 sugar cubes!

Snickers Fudge!

It is low-carb, virtually sugar-free, high in protein and good source of healthy fat.

Recipe:

Place the following into a bowl:

  • 1 TBSP of extra virgin coconut oil (EVCO): If necessary, liquify it in the microwave for 15 sec
  • 1 TBSP of Chocolate PB2 (or regular)
  • 1 scoop of BSN ISOBURN Chocolate Milkshake Whey
  • 2 TBSP of Walden Farm’s Calorie-Free Caramel Syrup
Mix the ingredients while adding a sparing amount of water until a very thick “goo” is achieved.
Pour the mixture into a small round dish (which has a layer of plastic wrap in it … for ease of removal).
Place it into the freezer to set for 40-60 minutes.
Once set, remove it from the dish, peel away the plastic wrap and ENJOY!

Nutritional Information:

  • calories: 273, fat: 16.5g, saturated fat: 13.5g, cholesterol: 10mg, sodium: 315 mg, carbohydrates: 8g, fiber: 2.5 g, NET CARBS: 5.5 g, sugars: 3.5g, protein: 22g

Ingredient Information:

=> Find detailed explanations about the ingredients used in this recipe in my Ingredient Encyclopaedia.

My thoughts on artificial sweeteners:

  • The caramel syrup I used in this recipe is calorie-free, sugar-free, carbohydrate-free, cholesterol-free, fat-free and gluten-free, making it a great option for people who are diabetic and/or trying to lose weight.  Note that a serving does contain 55mg of sodium.  Also note that it is artificially sweetened with sucralose (Splenda).
  • There is tremendous internet paranoia regarding the consumption of artificial sweeteners.  For my take on the topic, please read my articles:
    • The Artificial Sweetener Conundrum: In this evidence-based article, I investigate the pros and cons of sugar, natural sweeteners and artificial sweeteners
    • Stevia vs. Artificial Sweeteners vs. Sugar: Various stevia products are presented in this article
    • Sara’s Opinion: Yes, I do episodically consume stevia and Splenda. I take into consideration the risks and benefits. Everything in moderation: even moderation in moderation!

Snickers Reference: www.snickers.com

posts.title: Spicy Chicken Avocado Wraps
posts.content:
Spice up your Chicken!

Eating clean doesn’t mean you have to eat the same old boring chicken and veggies meal after meal.  Spice things up! Try my Spicy Chicken Avocado Wraps today!

Recipe:

  • Boil skinless, boneless chicken breasts in water (with fresh squeezed lemon).
  • Once the chicken is cooked, strain it and add 6 oz of this chicken to a food processor.
  • To the food processor, add 2/3 of an avocado and 2 cups of chopped & steamed zucchini.
  • Season with minced onion flakes, chili pepper flakes and 1 TBSP of freshly squeezed lime juice.
  • Process in the food processor (don’t over-process, or else it will become a paste).
  • Divide into 2 portions (place on in the fridge for the next day)
  • Wash and dry collard greens.  Cut off the stems.
  • Placed the chicken salad onto 1 collard green.  Roll into a wrap.  Makes about 3-4 wraps per serving.

Nutritional Info:

For a 1/2 serving (3 oz chicken, 1 cup zucchini, 1/3 of an avocado, 1 cup of collard greens):

  • calories: 253, fat: 12.4 g, saturated fat:1.6 g,  cholesterol: 56.3 mg, sodium: 71.2 mg, carbohydrates: 17.7 mg, fiber: 8.4 g, net carbs: 9.3g, sugar: 8.1 g, protein: 24.3 g

Ingredient Information: 

=> Find detailed explanations about the ingredients used in this recipe in my Ingredient Encyclopedia.

Video Demonstration:

Note: The video uses 4 oz of chicken and ½ an avocado per serving.  I personally found this to be too much food, so I lessened the portions to 3 oz of chicken and 1/3 an avocado per serving.

posts.title: Celery & Shrimp Pasta
posts.content:
Celery Celebration:

Celery is “not just water you have to chew!”

  • Not only is celery high in filling fiber, but it is also low in calories and extremely portable.
  • Celery is frequently touted as a “negative calorie food”, which would mean you would burn more calories than the celery actually contains just by chewing, swallowing, digesting and eliminating it.
  • According to Nancy Snyderman, MD (medical editor of NBC News), the calories burned in the total digestion process of celery are negligible.

Regardless of what you believe about celery, there is no denying it is a very filling and nutrient-packed low-calorie vegetable that is wiser to eat than the physique-sabotaging foods you are trying to avoid.

1.  Celery & Shrimp “Pasta” 

  • Peel 4 celery stalks into noodle shapes (use vegetable peeler)
  • Place “noodles” into boiling water (with fresh squeezed lemon) for 10 minutes
  • Strain
  • Add ½ of a squeezed lemon and salt-free lemon pepper
  • Add 4oz of cooked shrimp
  • optional: 1 tbsp of seafood sauce

Nutritional Information:

(with seafood sauce)

calories: 103, fat: 1.5g, saturated fat: 0.5g, cholesterol: 206.7mg, sodium: 495.8mg, carbohydrates: 4.5g, fiber: 0.5g, sugars: 3.8g, protein: 19g

Ingredient Information:

=> Find detailed explanations of the ingredients used in this recipe in my Ingredient Encyclopaedia.

posts.title: Taco Boats
posts.content:
TACOS!

And on the 6th day, God said, “Let there be tacos”.  And there they were.

Tacos are the best food ever made… until you look at the nutritional information – or shall I say, nuTRASHional information??? This fast food taco dinner has 1110 calories!  And it’s only 1 meal!!!

  •  30 oz Pepsi: 380 calories, 0 fat, 0 saturated fat, 0 cholesterol, 75mg sodium: , 105 g carbohydrates,  0g fiber, 105 mg sugars, 0 protein
  • DOUBLE DECKER® Taco Supreme®: 350 calories, 16g fat, 6 g saturated fat, 35 mg cholesterol, 670 mg sodium, 40 g carbohydrates, 7g fiber, 3 g sugars, 14 g protein
  • Doritos® 1 serving = 45 g: 230 calories: , 12 g fat, 2 g saturated fat, 0 cholesterol, 320 mg sodium, 29 g carbohydrates,  2 g fiber, 1 g sugars, 3 g protein
  • TOTAL: 1110 calories, 28 g fat, 8g saturated fat, 35 mg cholesterol, 1065 mg sodium, 174 g carbohydrates,  9 g fiber, 109 mg sugars, 17 g protein
Sugar & Salt:

  • Did you know that 109 mg of sugar is the equivalent of eating 27 sugar cubes?
  • According to the American Heart Association’s (AHA) report published in the journal Circulation, several studies have linked high sugar intake to insulin resistance, high blood pressure, high triglycerides and type 2 diabetes.  And let’s not forget about dental decay!
  • Health Canada has set the adequate daily intake of sodium at 1500mg (with an upper tolerable limit of 2300mg).
  • Salt is ubiquitous, and thanks to sodium-laced processed and restaurant foods, Canadians are now consuming an average of 3100mg of sodium a day!
  • Excessive sodium intake can cause high blood pressure, which is linked to an increased risk of heart attack, stroke and kidney disease.

Taco Boats!

My tacos get a 10 out of 10 on the TACOmeter.  (taco pun)

Recipe:

  • Steam 1 zucchini in the microwave for 2 minutes
  • Slice the zucchini (lengthwise) in half, scoop out the center
  • In a non-stick skillet (or use PAM non-stick cooking spray), cook 2 oz of extra lean ground chicken (preferably white meat)
  • Spoon the chicken into the depression you created in each zucchini
  • Add 1 TBSP of Daiya Dairy-Free Pepperjack Style Shreds  (Vegan cheese)
  • Add 2 tsp of nutritional yeast
  • Add 1 TBSP of low-sodium salsa, such as Green Mountain Gringo Medium Salsa 
  • Microwave for 1 additional minute to melt the faux cheese

Nutritional Information:

  • taco boats: 176 calories, 7.7 g fat, 5.6 g saturated fat, 42.8mg cholesterol, 140.6 mg sodium,13.2 g carbohydrates, 5.1 g fiber, 11.5 gsugars, 17.2 g protein
  • almonds snack pack: 100 calories, 8.5 g fat, 0.6 g saturated fat, 0 cholesterol, 0 sodium, 3.4 g carbohydrates , 2.3 g fiber, 0.6 g sugars, 3.4 g protein
  • total: calories: 279, fat: 16.3g, saturated fat: 6.2 g , cholesterol: 42.8 mg , sodium: 140.6 mg , carbohydrates: 16.6g ,  fiber: 7.3 g, net carbs: 9.3 g, sugars: 12.1 g, protein 20.6 g

Notice I substituted the pop with Matcha Green Tea:

Matcha Green Tea: Trade in your sugary soda pop for Matcha Green Tea or Oolong Tea.  The many purported health benefits of these teas include their potential to fight cancer and heart disease, lower “bad” (LDL) cholesterol, burn fat, prevent diabetes and stroke and even ward off dementia. For more information, read my article, “Matcha Green & Oolong Tea“.

Tip: Consider purchasing 100-calorie raw almond snack packs to assist with portion control. Inattention to portion size is a major contributor to weight gain, regardless of whether the food ingested is healthy. Almonds provide an excellent source of heart-healthy fats, protein and fiber.

Ingredient Information:

==> Find detailed explanations of the ingredients I used in this recipe in my Ingredient Encyclopaedia.

posts.title: Zero Calorie Dinner!
posts.content:
I’m Calling the Calorie Cops!

You have a dilemma. The night is young, you have already eaten your daily caloric allotment, but you are STILL HUNGRY!  Or as I like to call it, HANGRY (Hungry + Angry).

Pop Quiz: Do you

a) Cheat on your diet and binge on the first thing you find in your pantry (cookies???) and gain weight?

b) Stay hungry and irritable?

c) Eat a Zero Calorie Dinner that allows you to feel full without eating in caloric surplus for the day.

Correct Answer: c

This recipe is a life-saver (and a physique-saver)!

Zero Calorie Tomato Risotto!

  • Tastes great!
  • Satisfies hunger (High in fiber).
  • Zero calories! Zero guilt!
  • Soy-free, gluten-free
  • Quick & easy (Only 3 ingredients!)

Recipe:

  • Drain the water out of a package of Miracle Rice.  Rinse the rice  in cool water for 10-15 sec.  Blanch in boiling water for 60 sec.  Dry on a paper towel and place in a bowl.
  • Add 1 TBSP of  Walden Farms Calorie Free Tomato & Basil Pasta Sauce
  • Season with salt-free Mrs. Dash

Nutritional Information:

  • Calories: 0, fat: 0, saturated fat: 0, cholesterol 0, sodium: 87.5mg, carbohydrates: 0, sugars: 0, sugar alcohols: 0, protein: 0

Ingredient Information:

=>Find detailed explanations of the ingredients used in this recipe in my Ingredient Encyclopaedia.

posts.title: Cookie Dough Cheesecake
posts.content:
Say Cheese…cake!

Losing weight isn’t the hardest part: it’s maintaining the weight loss that is most difficult.  Did you know that only 5% of people who lose weight are able to keep it off in the long term? Thanks to my approach to intermittent fasting and flexible dieting, it’s a piece of cake keeping the fat off! (literally!).

My Cookie Dough Cheesecake is delicious!  I was reluctant to give this recipe away (it’s like a government secret) – but it’s just too good not to be shared with everyone!

My cheesecake is:

  • Low net carbs, Low Sugar, High Fibre
  • High protein
  • Low fat
  • Low sodium
  • NO BAKE!

Recipe:

=>Cookie Dough Balls:

Mix by hand the following:

  • 2 TBSP Chocolate PB2 with 2 TBSP Walden Farms Sugar Free/Calorie Free Pancake Syrup
  • This creates a paste: make 12 balls from the paste (roll it between your palms).  Add 1 cacao nib to each ball (or you could use a >70% dark chocolate chip).  Set aside.
=>Cheesecake Filling:

In a clean food processor, blend the following:

  • 1 cup of peeled uncooked zucchini (use a peeler).  Thoroughly puree the zucchini in the food processor (you don’t want chunks). Do this first before adding the next ingredients.
  • Pinch of cinnamon
  • 3 drops of Capella Flavour Drops (New York Cheesecake) (optional) or 8 g of Jell-O Sugar Free Cheesecake pudding mix (optional)
  • 1/2 tsp lemon juice 
  • 1/4 tsp vanilla extract
  • 2 scoops BSN ISOBURN whey (vanilla ice cream flavour)
  • 2 TBSP Toffuti Cream Cheese (Vegan Cream Cheese) OR if you want a soy-free option, then use Daiya Dairy Free Cream Cheese Style Spread. You could also use low fat cream cheese or low fat cottage cheese if you don’t have an allergy to dairy.
  • 2 TBSP water
  • 1 tsp cacao nibs (or you can substitute with >70% dark chocolate chips)
  • 1/2 tsp nutritional yeast (otherwise the cheesecake is too sweet, and it gives the cheesecake an authentic flavour)

Pour the cheesecake mixture into a small spring form pan.

  • Insert the 12 cookie dough balls into the cheesecake
  • Create the caramel “swirl”:  refer to the photo to see how I added the Walden Farms sugar free/calorie free caramel syrup on the top of the cheesecake. Then I used a knife tip to swirl it into a pretty design.  I also decorated the top of the cheesecake with a few extra raw cacao nibs. Feel free to substitute with dark chocolate chips (>70% recommended).
Place in the freezer for an hour.  Let it thaw on the counter for 5-10 minutes before serving.

Nutritional Information:

For my ENTIRE cheesecake (eat it all!). Note it will vary if you used the substitutions:

  • calories: 365 calories, fat: 9.4 g, saturated fat: 2.6g, cholesterol: 20mg, sodium: 478.9mg, carbohydrates: 26g, fiber: 9.3 g, net carbs: 16.7g, sugars: 12.8 g, protein: 47.3g

Let’s compare mine to 1 slice Cheesecake Factory’s Cookie Dough Cheesecake:

  • calories: 1090, fat: 72g, saturated fat: 38g, cholesterol: 290, sodium: 730mg, carbohydrates: 102g, fiber: 3g, sugars: 70 g, protein: 15g
  • Wowsers! Did you see how many carbohydrates and sugars are swimming in the Cheesecake Factory Cheesecake?  It’s no secret that excess sugar consumption is implicated in obesity.

Ingredient Information:

=> Find detailed explanations about the ingredients used in this recipe in my Ingredient Encyclopaedia.

If this is too much work, then just order Quest Nutrition’s Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough protein bars!

posts.title: Casein Cookie Dough
posts.content:
My debut as a Team Bodybuilding.com Athlete!

I am blessed to be a writer for bodybuilding.com and I am proud to be a part of their quest to help people achieve their health and fitness goals through information, motivation and supplementation. Did you know that bodybuilding.com is not only THE most visited bodybuilding and fitness website, but it is also the #1 sports nutrition e-retailer in the WORLD??!!

What is Casein? 

You may be wondering… What is Casein Protein?

I’m sure you have heard of Whey Protein, which is used immediately post-workout because it digests quickly to help you build muscle.  Casein protein, however, digests SLOWLY, providing a slow-release amino stream for an 8 hour period.  This means it can be used to help repair muscle and prevent muscle breakdown while you sleep for 8 hours.  Therefore, the optimal time to take it would be before bed.

Another option is to mix it with whey protein (50/50) to create a powerful dual-function protein cocktail.

While on the topic of casein protein that tastes like cookies…. try this recipe!

Recipe:

  • it’s a delicious guilt-free dessert before bed
  • it promotes satiety (ie. keeps you full for hours)
  • quick, easy and affordable
  • it helps you maintain your hard earned muscle while maintaining a lean physique (regardless of gender!!!… yes ladies… try this too!)

  1. Add 1 scoop of Bodybuilding.com 100% Casein  - Vanilla into a mixing bowl.  It’s important to use casein protein rather than whey because casein is thicker and creamier.
  2. Add 1 TBSP of all natural cashew butter (a healthy fat that promotes satiety!) or you can use all natural peanut butter, PB2, or my favourite: P28 high protein white chocolate spread!
  3. Pour 1/3 to 1/2 cup of unsweetened vanilla almond milk (or water).  Do not over-saturate, or else the mixture will be runny! You can either mix with a food processor (or by hand) until a dough-like consistency is achieved.
  4. Add 1 tsp of Raw Cacao Nibs (mix these by hand into the dough) or use chocolate chips.

Nutritional Information:

(using the cashew butter version)

calories: 270 fat: 13g, saturated fat: 2g cholesterol 15mg, sodium: 302.1mg,  carbohydrates 11g, fiber 2.1 g, sugars: 3.2, protein 28.5g

Ingredient Information:

=> Find detailed explanations of the ingredients used in this recipe in my ingredient encyclopaedia!

click for more info about P28 high protein spreads!

If you’re not in the mood to make this recipe, then I suggest you microwave a Quest Nutrition Chocolate Chip Cookie Dough Bar in the microwave for 15 seconds instead! lol.

posts.title: Crab Cakes
posts.content:
Crabby? I have a Solution!

Don’t sabotage your clean eating regime by splurging on conventional deep fried crab cakes rife with butter and mayo!  Make and eat these fabulously clean crab cakes instead!

Video Demo:

Check out this video of me making the Clean Crab Cakes for Oxygen Magazine!

 RECIPE

  • Place 2 GG Scandinavian Bran Crispbreads into a spice/coffee grinder or Magic Bullet:  grind into crumbs.
  • Then also add the following to the mixer and blend:
    • 3 oz crab meat
    • 1/4 cup egg whites
    • 1/2 cup spinach
    • 1 tsp dehydrated onion flakes
    • 1/2 tsp chili pepper flakes
    • Pepper
    • Squeeze the juice from ½ a lime
  • Add 1 TBSP extra virgin coconut oil (EVCO) to a skillet. Or save on calories and fat by using a non-stick cooking spray (PAM).
  • Divide the crab mixture into small cakes on the skillet.  Cook 3-4 minutes each side.
  • Plate dish and serve.

Yields ~ 8 cakes

Nutritional Information:

For 8 cakes (using coconut oil):

  • calories: 294, fat: 15.5g, saturated fat: 13.2g, cholesterol: 60.4mg, sodium: 760.3mg, sodium 760.3mg, carbohydrates: 16.8g, fibre: 107g, net carbs: 6.1g, sugars: 0.9g, protein: 29.9g

Compare this to 1 serving of conventional crab cakes:

  •  Calories: 409,  Fat: 31.6g, Cholesterol: 71mg
  • Note: conventional crab cake ingredients: saltine crackers, mayonnaise, mustard, onion, celery, old bay seasoning, crabmeat

Ingredient Information:

=> Find detailed explanations of the ingredients used in this recipe in my Ingredient Encyclopaedia.

posts.title: Mac ‘n Cheese
posts.content:
Gluten-free/Dairy-free RECIPE:

Two Easy Steps:

Step 1: “Macaroni”

  • Drain and thoroughly rinse 1 package (8 oz) of House Foods Tofu Shirataki Macaroni.
  • Boil for 2-3 min
  • Dry very well
Step 2: “Cheese Sauce”
  • 1/4 cup unsweetened unflavoured almond milk: place in microwave 60 sec
  • then add 1 TBSP nutritional yeast
  • season with pepper, salt-free Mrs Dash, hot chill pepper flakes, dehydrated minced onion flakes, etc.
  • Then combine your macaroni and cheese sauce!
  • Enjoy!

Theme & Variations:

add chicken!

Nutritional Information:

calories: 73, fat: 1.9g, saturated fat: 0.1g, cholesterol: 0mg, sodium: 77.5mg, carbohydrate: 9g, net carbs: 2.7, fibre: 6.3g, sugar 0.5g, protein: 6.3g

posts.title: Chocolate Meringue Pies
posts.content:
Do you want abs and yummy desserts?

Normally these two propositions are pairwise mutually exclusive (meaning they both cannot be true simultaneously)….. until NOW!

Thanks to Sara, you can have the best of both worlds!   So without further adieu, the Most Amazingalicious Guilt-Free Chocolate Meringue Desserts as featured on Dr. Sara Solomon’s Hard CORE Cooking Show!


Dessert #1: A Blow-Torched Chocolate Meringue Mini Pie!

The Crust:

-place plastic wrap into a small round container

-Mix the following in a magic bullet or food processor:

- one GG bran Scandinavian crispbread.  Click on the photo to purchase:


-1/4 tsp cinnamon

-1/4 tsp of vanilla extract

-1 tsp extra virgin coconut oil (liquefy it by heating it).  Click on the photo to purchase:

 

=> press the crust mixture into the base of the container

 

Chocolate Fudge Filling:

-1 scoop chocolate About Time whey isolate protein powder: Purchase here for 5% off using promo code “drsolomon”.

-2 TBSP unsweetened almond chocolate milk (or water)

-1/4 tsp cinnamon

-1/4 tsp vanilla extract (optional)

-1 tsp coconut oil

-mix (use magic bullet electric hand mixer or mix by hand) until an icing consistency is achieved, then add ½ tsp of glucomannan to thicken it.  Mix agai

 –> What is Glucomannan Powder?

  • Konjac glucomannan is a water-soluble dietary fiber derived from the root of the Konjac plant.  When glucomannan powder is mixed with water, it forms an extremely viscous solution.  In fact, it has the highest water holding capacity of any soluble fiber – up to 100 times its own water weight!
  • Glucomannan Powder and Pasta contain zero net carbohydrates, zero calories, no fat, no sugar, no starch and no protein.  They are wheat and gluten free, pure vegetable, do not require refrigeration, organic and flavourless (but absorb the flavours of your food).
  • Dietary soluble fiber can lower blood cholesterol. Foods high in soluble fiber help prevent your blood sugar levels from rising too high after meals by keeping food in the stomach longer (great for type 2 diabetics).
  • How to use Glucomannan Powder1:
  1. Drink 1 tsp of it with 1 cup of water 3 times a day (before your meals).  Drink it immediately before it begins to gel.
  2. Use it as a thickening agent.  It can be used to thicken sauces, gravies, puddings and pie fillings without affecting taste.  It dissolves into hot or cold liquids.                                                                                              

        Reference: http://www.konjacfoods.com

Purchase by clicking on the photo:

The Meringue Topping:

-in a sauce pan, heat 80 mL of water with 1 scoop of Fitlicious Caramel Caress Stevia to 119 degrees celcius.  Purchase stevia here.

-while waiting for the caramel sauce to heat to temperature, mix 4 egg whites (1/2 cup) in a large bowl using an electric hand mixer.  Once the egg whites become stiff, pour in the caramel syrup with ½ tsp of glucomannan and continue whipping until peaks form (~ 3min).

 

Blow Torch Time:

-remove the dessert from the freezer. Remove the dessert from the container by lifting the plastic wrap.  Plate the fudge pie.

-place a spoonful of meringue on top of the fudge pie.

-“toast” the meringue using the blow torch for a baked look.

 

Nutritional Info for 1 entire pie:

Net Carbs: 12.2g – 9.1g = 3.9g

posts.title: Chocolate Avocado Dessert Pudding
posts.content:
Avocado in my Dessert? 

I know what you are thinking:  GROSS-A-LOSSE & VOMIT-INDUCING!!!  A dessert made with avocado??   Just trust me on this one!  I promise once you try my pudding, you will instantly feel the glow of total joy spreading throughout your body … otherwise known as entering into a state of “AVOCADOPIA”.

Recipe:

Sara’s Chocolate Avocado Pudding Extravaganza!

1.  Slice 1 ripe (ie. mushy) avocado in half, remove the pit.  (Note: store unripe avocados on the counter and ripe avocados in the fridge.)

2.  Place one half into a bowl, return the other half to the fridge for another day.

3.  Mash the avocado in the bowl with a fork until it is smooth and creamy.  This represents ~1/3 cup of pureed avocado.

4.  Add 1/2 scoop of BSN Syntha-6 Whey (chocolate milkshake flavour).

5.  Slowly add water while stirring until a creamy pudding consistency is achieved.  Blend this with the avocado.

6.  Optional: sprinkle with cinnamon, add a scoop of chocolate flavoured stevia powder, add 1 tsp of raw cacao nibs.

7.  Enjoy or refrigerate for later.

Nutritional Information:

(for just the whey and avocado)

  • calories: 261, fat: 17.7 g, saturated fat: 3.1 g, cholesterol: 35mg, sodium: 117mg, carbohydrates: 16.1g, fiber: 9.2 g, sugar: 1.7 g, protein: 13 g

Ingredient Information:

=> Find detailed explanations about the ingredients I used in this recipe by clicking on my Ingredient Encyclopedia!

posts.title: Tilapia Sliders Recipe
posts.content:
Tilapi-abs

Want abs?

Here is my “hard core” staple:  TILAPIA…. but reinvented!

Recipe: 

Place the following ingredients into a food processor:

  •     2 uncooked fresh tilapia cut into small strips (use scissors)
  •     2 cups steamed broccoli florets (I buy the florets in the bag you steam in your microwave to save time)
  •     Salt-free Mrs. Dash
  •     Pepper
  •     Squirt half a lime
  •     1 TBSP of dehydrated sliced onion  (adds flavour and is quicker than slicing an onion and less pungent)
  •     1/2 TBSP chopped cilantro  (I buy it in the squeezable tubes to save time).
  •     Blend the ingredients in the food processor.
  •     Roll into small patties
  •     Place on griddler (I use Pam non-stick cooking spray) for 10 minutes
  •     Refrigerate for up to 4 days.

You can enjoy them cold the next day too!  They are portable, so you do not require cutlery to eat them.   These are perfect for those busy workdays when we only get 2 minutes for lunch.

Nutritional Information

->for 1 serving of sliders: (4 oz of tilapia and 1 cup (65g) of broccoli florets):
Depending upon the size of your sliders, 1 serving size will be approximately 4-5 sliders (I recommend you weigh your food to ensure your portions are correct)

  • Calories: 113, fat: 1 g, saturated fat: 0.5g, cholesterol: 55mg, sodium: 60 mg, carbohydrate: 3g, fibre: 2 g, sugar: 1 g, protein: 23 g

posts.title: Vanilla Walnut Shortbread Kookies
posts.content:
By:  Joanne Gero, Naturopath N.D., Health, Wellness & Raw Food Coach.   www.vibealive.ca

 

 

Ingredients

2 cups raw walnuts
1 cup unsweetened finely shredded coconut
1/4 cup raw honey
1 tsp “Frontier” non alcohol vanilla extract
pinch sea salt

Making the Kookie Dough

Food process until a granular moist dough forms about 60 seconds.

Be careful during food processing time, if you over-process it will become oily as the healthy fats extrude from the walnut.

Roll 1 tbsp of dough into ball and flatten into desired kookie size and shapes.

OH SOOO YUMMY IN YOUR TUMMY!!!

posts.title_plain: Raw Vegan Chocolate Chip Kookie Dough Bites
posts.content:
By:  Joanne Gero, Naturopath N.D., Health, Wellness & Raw Food Coach.   www.vibealive.ca

Joanne’s Kookie Dough Bites are sweet, soft and chewy and totally to die for!

Eat them as is, or drench them in organic vegan chocolate!

Ingredients

1 cup raw organic almonds, cashews or macadamia nuts (soaked & dehydrated); if no time or no dehydrator, using them dry is fine.

1 cup raw organic oat groats (dry, grind into powder using coffee grinder)

½ cup raw dehydrated coconut (or can simply use a organic shredded coconut if you that’s all you have)

10 organic medjool dates

4-5 tbsp. agave, raw honey or maple syrup (not raw though)

1 tbsp. vanilla extract (Frontier is my favourite) any organic non-alcohol brand will do

½ tsp. Pink Himalayan or Celtic Sea Salt

½ cup of homemade raw vegan chocolate chips, or you can use 1/2 cup of fair-trade organic vegan chocolate chips to make it a lot easier, but not raw.

Making the Kookie Dough

  1. Process in food processor the almonds until fine like a powder but not oily.
  2. Add powdered raw oats, shredded coconut, salt, agave, and dates.
  3. Process until everything is mixed well and a kookie dough ball begins to form.

(If you find that the batter is too dry add few more tbsp. of agave).

IMPORTANT NOTE: **Set aside in case dough is slightly warm, otherwise the chips will melt.

Form into desired kookie size or can roll them into some awesome kookie dough bites. Refrigerate for 1 hour.

Another option is to drench them in melted organic vegan chocolate, and then refrigerate for 1 hour.

These last about 4-5 days refrigerated, but I doubt they’ll be around long.
